PeakUsagemax.desc: The maximum peak Java  memory pool available.

PeakUsageused.desc: The total peak Java memory pool used.

Usagecommitted.desc: The total Java memory pool committed to be used

Usageinit.desc: The initial Java memory pool allocated

Usagemax.desc: The maximum Java  memory pool available.

Usageused.desc: The total Java memory pool used.

TotalStartedThreadCount.desc: The total count of started thread.

executor_count.desc: The number of executors available to Jenkins

executor_free_count.desc: The number of executors available to Jenkins that are not currently in use.

executor_in_use_count.desc: The number of executors available to Jenkins that are currently in use.

job_count.desc: The number of jobs in Jenkins

node_offline_count.desc: The number of build nodes available to Jenkins but currently off-line.

node_online_count.desc: The number of build nodes available to Jenkins and currently on-line.

plugins_active.desc: The number of plugins in the Jenkins instance that started successfully.

plugins_failed.desc: The number of plugins in the Jenkins instance that failed to start.

project_count.desc: The number of project to Jenkins

queue_blocked.desc: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state.

queue_buildable.desc: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state.

queue_pending.desc: Number of times a Job has been Pending in a Queue

queue_size.desc: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue.

queue_stuck.desc: he number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state

system_cpu_load.desc: The system load on the Jenkins controller as reported by the JVM’s Operating System JMX bean

vm_blocked_count.desc: The number of threads in the Jenkins JVM that are currently blocked waiting for a monitor lock.

vm_count.desc: The total number of threads in the Jenkins JVM. This is the sum of: vm.blocked.count, vm.new.count, vm.runnable.count, vm.terminated.count, vm.timed_waiting.count and vm.waiting.count

vm_cpu_load.desc: The rate of CPU time usage by the JVM per unit time on the Jenkins controller. This is equivalent to the number of CPU cores being used by the Jenkins JVM.

vm_memory_total_used.desc: The total amount of memory that the Jenkins JVM is currently using.(Units of measurement: bytes)

kafka_connect.desc: 该指标集需在 Connector 实例上采集

last_error_timestamp.desc: The epoch timestamp when this task last encountered an error in millisecond.

kafka_consumer.desc: 该指标集需在 Consumer 实例上采集

kafka_producer.desc: 该指标集需在 Producer 实例上采集

memory_usage_bytes.desc: The number of memory used in bytes

cluster_name.Desc: The name of the cluster which the object belongs to.

namespace.Desc: Namespace defines the space within each name must be unique.

active.desc: Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary. (Darwin, Linux)

cached.desc: In-memory cache for files read from the disk. (Linux)

commit_limit.desc: This is the total amount of memory currently available to be allocated on the system. (Linux)

committed_as.desc: The amount of memory presently allocated on the system. (Linux)

dirty.desc: Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk. (Linux)

huge_page_total.desc: The size of the pool of huge pages. (Linux)

huge_pages_free.desc: The number of huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated. (Linux)

inactive.desc: Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes. (Darwin, Linux)

mapped.desc: Files which have been mapped into memory, such as libraries. (Linux)

page_tables.desc: Amount of memory dedicated to the lowest level of page tables. (Linux)

sreclaimable.desc: Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches. (Linux)

sunreclaim.desc: Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure. (Linux)

swap_cached.desc: Memory that once was swapped out, is swapped back in but still also is in the swap file. (Linux)

swap_free.desc: Amount of swap space that is currently unused. (Linux)

swap_total.desc: Total amount of swap space available. (Linux)

vmalloc_chunk.desc: Largest contiguous block of vmalloc area which is free. (Linux)

vmalloc_total.desc: Total size of vmalloc memory area. (Linux)

vmalloc_used.desc: Amount of vmalloc area which is used. (Linux)

write_back.desc: Memory which is actively being written back to the disk. (Linux)

write_back_tmp.desc: Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers. (Linux)

accepting_conns.desc: Whether or not server is accepting conns

auth_cmds.desc: Number of authentication commands handled, success or failure

bytes.desc: Current number of bytes used to store items

bytes_read.desc: Total number of bytes read by this server from network

bytes_written.desc: Total number of bytes sent by this server to network

cas_badval.desc: Number of CAS reqs for which a key was found, but the CAS value did not match

cas_misses.desc: Number of CAS reqs against missing keys

conn_yields.desc: Number of times any connection yielded to another due to hitting the -R limit

connection_structures.desc: Number of connection structures allocated by the server

decr_misses.desc: Number of decr reqs against missing keys

delete_hits.desc: Number of deletion reqs resulting in an item being removed

delete_misses.desc: umber of deletions reqs for missing keys

evicted_unfetched.desc: Items evicted from LRU that were never touched by get/incr/append/etc

evictions.desc: Number of valid items removed from cache to free memory for new items

expired_unfetched.desc: Items pulled from LRU that were never touched by get/incr/append/etc before expiring

get_hits.desc: Number of keys that have been requested and found present

get_misses.desc: Number of items that have been requested and not found

hash_bytes.desc: Bytes currently used by hash tables

hash_is_expanding.desc: Indicates if the hash table is being grown to a new size

hash_power_level.desc: Current size multiplier for hash table

incr_misses.desc: Number of incr reqs against missing keys

limit_maxbytes.desc: Number of bytes this server is allowed to use for storage

listen_disabled_num.desc: Number of times server has stopped accepting new connections (maxconns)

reclaimed.desc: Number of times an entry was stored using memory from an expired entry

total_connections.desc: Total number of connections opened since the server started running

total_items.desc: Total number of items stored since the server started

touch_hits.desc: Number of keys that have been touched with a new expiration time

touch_misses.desc: Number of items that have been touched and not found

uptime.desc: Number of secs since the server started

server.Desc: The host name from which metrics are gathered

active_reads.desc: The number of the active client connections performing read operations.

active_writes.desc: The number of active client connections performing write operations.

aggregate_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'aggregate' command failed on this mongod

aggregate_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'aggregate' command executed on this mongod.

assert_msg.desc: The number of message assertions raised since the MongoDB process started. Check the log file for more information about these messages.

assert_regular.desc: The number of regular assertions raised since the MongoDB process started. Check the log file for more information about these messages.

assert_rollovers.desc: The number of times that the rollover counters have rolled over since the last time the MongoDB process started. The counters will rollover to zero after 2 30 assertions. Use this value to provide context to the other values in the asserts data structure.

assert_user.desc: The number of "user asserts" that have occurred since the last time the MongoDB process started. These are errors that user may generate, such as out of disk space or duplicate key. You can prevent these assertions by fixing a problem with your application or deployment. Check the MongoDB log for more information.

assert_warning.desc: Changed in version 4.0. Starting in MongoDB 4.0, the field returns zero 0. In earlier versions, the field returns the number of warnings raised since the MongoDB process started.

available_reads.desc: The number of concurrent of read transactions allowed into the WiredTiger storage engine

available_writes.desc: The number of concurrent of write transactions allowed into the WiredTiger storage engine

commands.desc: The total number of commands issued to the database since the mongod instance last started. opcounters.command counts all commands except the write commands: insert, update, and delete.

connections_available.desc: The number of unused incoming connections available.

connections_current.desc: The number of incoming connections from clients to the database server .

connections_total_created.desc: Count of all incoming connections created to the server. This number includes connections that have since closed.

count_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'count' command failed on this mongod

count_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'count' command executed on this mongod

cursor_no_timeout_count.desc: The number of open cursors with the option DBQuery.Option.noTimeout set to prevent timeout after a period of inactivity

cursor_timed_out_count.desc: The total number of cursors that have timed out since the server process started. If this number is large or growing at a regular rate, this may indicate an application error.

cursor_total_count.desc: The number of cursors that MongoDB is maintaining for clients. Because MongoDB exhausts unused cursors, typically this value small or zero. However, if there is a queue, stale tailable cursors, or a large number of operations this value may rise.

delete_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'delete' command failed on this mongod

delete_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'delete' command executed on this mongod

deletes.desc: The total number of delete operations since the mongod instance last started.

distinct_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'distinct' command failed on this mongod

distinct_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'distinct' command executed on this mongod

document_deleted.desc: The total number of documents deleted.

document_inserted.desc: The total number of documents inserted.

document_returned.desc: The total number of documents returned by queries.

document_updated.desc: The total number of documents updated.

find_and_modify_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'find' and 'modify' commands failed on this mongod

find_and_modify_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'find' and 'modify' commands executed on this mongod

find_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'find' command failed on this mongod

find_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'find' command executed on this mongod

get_more_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'get more' command failed on this mongod

get_more_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'get more' command executed on this mongod

getmores.desc: The total number of getMore operations since the mongod instance last started. This counter can be high even if the query count is low. Secondary nodes send getMore operations as part of the replication process.

insert_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'insert' command failed on this mongod

insert_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'insert' command executed on this mongod

inserts.desc: The total number of insert operations received since the mongod instance last started.

jumbo_chunks.desc: Count jumbo flags in cluster chunk.

latency_commands.desc: The total combined latency in microseconds of latency statistics for database command.

latency_commands_count.desc: The total combined latency of operations performed on the collection for database command.

latency_reads.desc: The total combined latency in microseconds of latency statistics for read request.

latency_reads_count.desc: The total combined latency of operations performed on the collection for read request.

latency_writes.desc: The total combined latency in microseconds of latency statistics for write request.

latency_writes_count.desc: The total combined latency of operations performed on the collection for write request.

member_status.desc: The state of ndoe in replica members.

net_in_bytes_count.desc: The total number of bytes that the server has received over network connections initiated by clients or other mongod instances.

net_out_bytes_count.desc: The total number of bytes that the server has sent over network connections initiated by clients or other mongod instances.

open_connections.desc: The number of incoming connections from clients to the database server.

operation_scan_and_order.desc: The total number of queries that return sorted numbers that cannot perform the sort operation using an index.

operation_write_conflicts.desc: The total number of queries that encountered write conflicts.

page_faults.desc: The total number of page faults.

percent_cache_dirty.desc: Size in bytes of the dirty data in the cache. This value should be less than the bytes currently in the cache value.

percent_cache_used.desc: Size in byte of the data currently in cache. This value should not be greater than the maximum bytes configured value.

queries.desc: The total number of queries received since the mongod instance last started.

queued_reads.desc: The number of operations that are currently queued and waiting for the read lock. A consistently small read-queue, particularly of shorter operations, should cause no concern.

queued_writes.desc: The number of operations that are currently queued and waiting for the write lock. A consistently small write-queue, particularly of shorter operations, is no cause for concern.

repl_apply_batches_num.desc: The total number of batches applied across all databases.

repl_apply_batches_total_millis.desc: The total amount of time in milliseconds the mongod has spent applying operations from the oplog.

repl_apply_ops.desc: The total number of oplog operations applied. metrics.repl.apply.ops is incremented after each operation.

repl_buffer_count.desc: The current number of operations in the oplog buffer.

repl_buffer_size_bytes.desc: The current size of the contents of the oplog buffer.

repl_commands.desc: The total number of replicated commands issued to the database since the mongod instance last started.

repl_deletes.desc: The total number of replicated delete operations since the mongod instance last started.

repl_getmores.desc: The total number of getMore operations since the mongod instance last started.

repl_inserts.desc: The total number of replicated insert operations since the mongod instance last started.

repl_network_bytes.desc: The total amount of data read from the replication sync source.

repl_network_getmores_num.desc: The total number of getmore operations, which are operations that request an additional set of operations from the replication sync source.

repl_network_getmores_total_millis.desc: The total amount of time required to collect data from getmore operations.

repl_network_ops.desc: The total number of operations read from the replication source.

repl_oplog_window_sec.desc: The second window of replication oplog.

repl_queries.desc: The total number of replicated queries since the mongod instance last started.

repl_state.desc: The node state of replication member.

repl_updates.desc: The total number of replicated update operations since the mongod instance last started.

resident_megabytes.desc: The value of mem.resident is roughly equivalent to the amount of RAM, in mebibyte (MiB), currently used by the database process.

storage_freelist_search_bucket_exhausted.desc: The number of times that mongod has checked the free list without finding a suitably large record allocation.

storage_freelist_search_requests.desc: The number of times mongod has searched for available record allocations.

storage_freelist_search_scanned.desc: The number of available record allocations mongod has searched.

tcmalloc_central_cache_free_bytes.desc: Number of free bytes in the central cache that have been assigned to size classes. They always count towards virtual memory usage, and unless the underlying memory is swapped.

tcmalloc_current_allocated_bytes.desc: Number of bytes currently allocated by application.

tcmalloc_current_total_thread_cache_byte.desc: Number of bytes used across all thread caches.

tcmalloc_heap_size.desc: Number of bytes in the heap.

tcmalloc_max_total_thread_cache_bytes.desc: Upper limit on total number of bytes stored across all per-thread caches. Default: 16MB.

tcmalloc_pageheap_free_bytes.desc: Number of bytes in free, mapped pages in page heap.

tcmalloc_pageheap_scavenge_count.desc: Number of times scavagened flush pages.

tcmalloc_pageheap_total_commit_bytes.desc: Bytes committed in lifetime of process.

tcmalloc_pageheap_total_decommit_bytes.desc: Bytes decommitted in lifetime of process.

total_available.desc: The number of connections available from the mongos to the config servers, replica sets, and standalone mongod instances in the cluster.

total_created.desc: The number of connections the mongos has ever created to other members of the cluster.

total_docs_scanned.desc: The total number of index items scanned during queries and query-plan evaluation.

total_in_use.desc: Reports the total number of outgoing connections from the current mongod/mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster or replica set that are currently in use.

total_keys_scanned.desc: The total number of index items scanned during queries and query-plan evaluation.

total_refreshing.desc: Reports the total number of outgoing connections from the current mongod/mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster or replica set that are currently being refreshed.

total_tickets_reads.desc: A document that returns information on the number of concurrent of read transactions allowed into the WiredTiger storage engine.

total_tickets_writes.desc: A document that returns information on the number of concurrent of write transactions allowed into the WiredTiger storage engine.

ttl_deletes.desc: The total number of documents deleted from collections with a ttl index.

ttl_passes.desc: The number of times the background process removes documents from collections with a ttl index.

update_command_failed.desc: The number of times that 'update' command failed on this mongod

update_command_total.desc: The number of times that 'update' command executed on this mongod

updates.desc: The total number of update operations received since the mongod instance last started.

uptime_ns.desc: The total upon time of mongod in nano seconds.

vsize_megabytes.desc: mem.virtual displays the quantity, in mebibyte (MiB), of virtual memory used by the mongod process.

wtcache_pages_read_into.desc: Number of pages read into the cache.

wtcache_pages_requested_from.desc: Number of pages request from the cache.

avg_obj_size.desc: The average size of an object in the collection.

count.desc: The number of objects or documents in this collection.

size.desc: The total uncompressed size in memory of all records in a collection.

storage_size.desc: The total amount of storage allocated to this collection for document storage.

total_index_size.desc: The total size of all indexes.

avg_obj_size.desc: The average size of each document in bytes.

collections.desc: Contains a count of the number of collections in that database.

data_size.desc: The total size of the uncompressed data held in this database. The dataSize decreases when you remove documents.

index_size.desc: The total size of all indexes created on this database.

indexes.desc: Contains a count of the total number of indexes across all collections in the database.

objects.desc: Contains a count of the number of objects (i.e. documents) in the database across all collections.

storage_size.desc: The total amount of space allocated to collections in this database for document storage.

available.desc: The number of connections available for this host to connect to the mongos.

created.desc: The number of connections the host has ever created to connect to the mongos.

in_use.desc: Reports the total number of outgoing connections from the current mongod/mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster or replica set that are currently in use.

refreshing.desc: Reports the total number of outgoing connections from the current mongod/mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster or replica set that are currently being refreshed.

commands_count.desc: The total number of "command" event issues.

commands_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "command" costs.

get_more_count.desc: The total number of "getmore" event issues.

get_more_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "getmore" costs.

insert_count.desc: The total number of "insert" event issues.

insert_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "insert" costs.

queries_count.desc: The total number of "queries" event issues.

queries_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "queries" costs.

read_lock_count.desc: The total number of "readLock" event issues.

read_lock_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "readLock" costs.

remove_count.desc: The total number of "remove" event issues.

remove_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "remove" costs.

total_count.desc: The total number of "total" event issues.

total_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "total" costs.

update_count.desc: The total number of "update" event issues.

update_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "update" costs.

write_lock_count.desc: The total number of "writeLock" event issues.

write_lock_time.desc: The amount of time in microseconds that "writeLock" costs.

Aborted_clients.desc: The number of connections that were aborted because the client died without closing the connection properly.

Aborted_connects.desc: The number of failed attempts to connect to the MySQL server.

Binlog_cache_disk_use.desc: The number of transactions that used the temporary binary log cache but that exceeded the value of binlog_cache_size and used a temporary file to store statements from the transaction.

Binlog_cache_use.desc: The number of transactions that used the binary log cache.

Bytes_received.desc: The number of bytes received from all clients.

Bytes_sent.desc: The number of bytes sent to all clients.

Connections.desc: The rate of connections to the server.

Created_tmp_disk_tables.desc: The rate of internal on-disk temporary tables created by second by the server while executing statements.

Created_tmp_files.desc: The rate of temporary files created by second.

Created_tmp_tables.desc: The rate of internal temporary tables created by second by the server while executing statements.

Handler_commit.desc: The number of internal COMMIT statements.

Handler_delete.desc: The number of internal DELETE statements.

Handler_prepare.desc: The number of internal PREPARE statements.

Handler_read_first.desc: The number of internal READ_FIRST statements.

Handler_read_key.desc: The number of internal READ_KEY statements.

Handler_read_next.desc: The number of internal READ_NEXT statements.

Handler_read_prev.desc: The number of internal READ_PREV statements.

Handler_read_rnd.desc: The number of internal READ_RND statements.

Handler_read_rnd_next.desc: The number of internal READ_RND_NEXT statements.

Handler_rollback.desc: The number of internal ROLLBACK statements.

Handler_update.desc: The number of internal UPDATE statements.

Handler_write.desc: The number of internal WRITE statements.

Key_buffer_size.desc: Size of the buffer used for index blocks.

Key_read_requests.desc: The number of requests to read a key block from the MyISAM key cache.

Key_reads.desc: The number of physical reads of a key block from disk into the MyISAM key cache. If Key_reads is large, then your key_buffer_size value is probably too small. The cache miss rate can be calculated as Key_reads/Key_read_requests.

Key_write_requests.desc: The number of requests to write a key block to the MyISAM key cache.

Key_writes.desc: The number of physical writes of a key block from the MyISAM key cache to disk.

Max_used_connections.desc: The maximum number of connections that have been in use simultaneously since the server started.

Open_tables.desc: The number of of tables that are open.

Opened_tables.desc: The number of tables that have been opened. If Opened_tables is big, your table_open_cache value is probably too small.

Qcache_free_blocks.desc: The number of free memory blocks in the query cache.

Qcache_free_memory.desc: The amount of free memory for the query cache.

Qcache_hits.desc: The rate of query cache hits.

Qcache_inserts.desc: The number of queries added to the query cache.

Qcache_lowmem_prunes.desc: The number of queries that were deleted from the query cache because of low memory.

Qcache_not_cached.desc: The number of noncached queries (not cacheable, or not cached due to the query_cache_type setting).

Qcache_queries_in_cache.desc: The number of queries registered in the query cache.

Qcache_total_blocks.desc: The total number of blocks in the query cache.

Questions.desc: The rate of statements executed by the server.

Select_full_join.desc: The number of joins that perform table scans because they do not use indexes. If this value is not 0, you should carefully check the indexes of your tables.

Select_full_range_join.desc: The number of joins that used a range search on a reference table.

Select_range.desc: The number of joins that used ranges on the first table. This is normally not a critical issue even if the value is quite large.

Select_range_check.desc: The number of joins without keys that check for key usage after each row. If this is not 0, you should carefully check the indexes of your tables.

Select_scan.desc: The number of joins that did a full scan of the first table.

Sort_merge_passes.desc: The number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do. If this value is large, you should consider increasing the value of the sort_buffer_size system variable.

Sort_range.desc: The number of sorts that were done using ranges.

Sort_scan.desc: The number of sorts that were done by scanning the table.

Table_locks_immediate.desc: The number of times that a request for a table lock could be granted immediately.

Table_locks_waited.desc: The total number of times that a request for a table lock could not be granted immediately and a wait was needed.

Threads_cached.desc: The number of threads in the thread cache.

Threads_connected.desc: The number of currently open connections.

Threads_created.desc: The number of threads created to handle connections. If Threads_created is big, you may want to increase the thread_cache_size value.

Threads_running.desc: The number of threads that are not sleeping.

max_connections.desc: The maximum number of connections that have been in use simultaneously since the server started.

query_cache_size.desc: The amount of memory allocated for caching query results.

table_open_cache.desc: The number of open tables for all threads. Increasing this value increases the number of file descriptors that mysqld requires.

thread_cache_size.desc: How many threads the server should cache for reuse. When a client disconnects, the client's threads are put in the cache if there are fewer than thread_cache_size threads there.

mysql_dbm_metric.desc: 记录查询语句的执行次数、等待耗时、锁定时间和查询的记录行数等。

count_star.desc: The total count of executed queries per normalized query and schema.

message.desc: The text of the normalized statement digest.

sum_errors.desc: The total count of queries run with an error per normalized query and schema.

sum_lock_time.desc: The total time(nanosecond) spent waiting on locks per normalized query and schema.

sum_no_good_index_used.desc: The total count of queries which used a sub-optimal index per normalized query and schema.

sum_no_index_used.desc: The total count of queries which do not use an index per normalized query and schema.

sum_rows_affected.desc: The number of rows mutated per normalized query and schema.

sum_rows_examined.desc: The number of rows examined per normalized query and schema.

sum_rows_sent.desc: The number of rows sent per normalized query and schema.

sum_select_full_join.desc: The total count of full table scans on a joined table per normalized query and schema.

sum_select_scan.desc: The total count of full table scans on the first table per normalized query and schema.

sum_timer_wait.desc: The total query execution time(nanosecond) per normalized query and schema.

digest.Desc: The digest hash value computed from the original normalized statement.

query_signature.Desc: The hash value computed from digest_text

mysql_dbm_sample.desc: 选取部分执行耗时较高的 SQL 语句，获取其执行计划，并采集实际执行过程中的各种性能指标。

duration.desc: Value in nanoseconds of the event's duration.

lock_time_ns.desc: Time in nanoseconds spent waiting for locks.

message.desc: The text of the normalized statement digest.

no_good_index_used.desc: 0 if a good index was found for the statement, 1 if no good index was found.

no_index_used.desc: 0 if the statement performed a table scan with an index, 1 if without an index.

rows_affected.desc: Number of rows the statement affected.

rows_examined.desc: Number of rows read during the statement's execution.

select_full_join.desc: Number of joins performed by the statement which did not use an index.

select_full_range_join.desc: Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range search of the int first table.

select_range.desc: Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range of the first table.

select_range_check.desc: Number of joins without keys performed by the statement that check for key usage after int each row.

select_scan.desc: Number of joins performed by the statement which used a full scan of the first table.

sort_merge_passes.desc: Number of merge passes by the sort algorithm performed by the statement.

sort_range.desc: Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a range.

sort_rows.desc: Number of rows sorted by the statement.

sort_scan.desc: Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a full table scan.

timer_wait_ns.desc: Value in nanoseconds of the event's duration

timestamp.desc: The timestamp(millisecond) when then the event ends.

current_schema.Desc: The name of the current schema.

digest.Desc: The digest hash value computed from the original normalized statement.

network_client_ip.Desc: The ip address of the client

plan_definition.Desc: The plan definition of JSON format.

plan_signature.Desc: The hash value computed from plan definition.

processlist_user.Desc: The user name of the client.

query_signature.Desc: The hash value computed from digest_text.

query_truncated.Desc: It indicates whether the query is truncated.

resource_hash.Desc: The hash value computed from sql text.

adaptive_hash_searches.desc: Number of successful searches using Adaptive Hash Index

adaptive_hash_searches_btree.desc: Number of searches using B-tree on an index search

buffer_data_reads.desc: Amount of data read in bytes (innodb_data_reads)

buffer_data_written.desc: Amount of data written in bytes (innodb_data_written)

buffer_pool_pages_misc.desc: Buffer pages for misc use such as row locks or the adaptive hash index (innodb_buffer_pool_pages_misc)

buffer_pool_pages_total.desc: Total buffer pool size in pages (innodb_buffer_pool_pages_total)

buffer_pool_read_ahead.desc: Number of pages read as read ahead (innodb_buffer_pool_read_ahead)

buffer_pool_read_ahead_evicted.desc: Read-ahead pages evicted without being accessed (innodb_buffer_pool_read_ahead_evicted)

buffer_pool_reads.desc: Number of reads directly from disk (innodb_buffer_pool_reads)

buffer_pool_size.desc: Server buffer pool size (all buffer pools) in bytes

buffer_pool_wait_free.desc: Number of times waited for free buffer (innodb_buffer_pool_wait_free)

ibuf_merges_delete.desc: Number of purge records merged by change buffering

ibuf_merges_delete_mark.desc: Number of deleted records merged by change buffering

ibuf_merges_discard_delete.desc: Number of purge merged  operations discarded

ibuf_merges_discard_delete_mark.desc: Number of deleted merged operations discarded

ibuf_merges_discard_insert.desc: Number of insert merged operations discarded

ibuf_merges_insert.desc: Number of inserted records merged by change buffering

innodb_dblwr_pages_written.desc: Number of pages that have been written for doublewrite operations (innodb_dblwr_pages_written)

innodb_dblwr_writes.desc: Number of doublewrite operations that have been performed (innodb_dblwr_writes)

innodb_rwlock_s_os_waits.desc: Number of OS waits due to shared latch request

innodb_rwlock_s_spin_rounds.desc: Number of rwlock spin loop rounds due to shared latch request

innodb_rwlock_s_spin_waits.desc: Number of rwlock spin waits due to shared latch request

innodb_rwlock_sx_os_waits.desc: Number of OS waits due to sx latch request

innodb_rwlock_sx_spin_rounds.desc: Number of rwlock spin loop rounds due to sx latch request

innodb_rwlock_sx_spin_waits.desc: Number of rwlock spin waits due to sx latch request

innodb_rwlock_x_os_waits.desc: Number of OS waits due to exclusive latch request

innodb_rwlock_x_spin_rounds.desc: Number of rwlock spin loop rounds due to exclusive latch request

innodb_rwlock_x_spin_waits.desc: Number of rwlock spin waits due to exclusive latch request

lock_row_lock_current_waits.desc: Number of row locks currently being waited for (innodb_row_lock_current_waits)

lock_row_lock_time.desc: Time spent in acquiring row locks, in milliseconds (innodb_row_lock_time)

lock_row_lock_time_avg.desc: The average time to acquire a row lock, in milliseconds (innodb_row_lock_time_avg)

lock_row_lock_time_max.desc: The maximum time to acquire a row lock, in milliseconds (innodb_row_lock_time_max)

lock_row_lock_waits.desc: Number of times a row lock had to be waited for (innodb_row_lock_waits)

log_padded.desc: Bytes of log padded for log write ahead

log_waits.desc: Number of log waits due to small log buffer (innodb_log_waits)

os_log_pending_writes.desc: Number of pending log file writes (innodb_os_log_pending_writes)

mysql_schema.desc: 具体字段，以实际采集上来的数据为准，部分字段，会因 MySQL 配置、已有数据等原因，采集不到

query_run_time_avg.desc: Avg query response time per schema.

data_free.desc: The number of rows. Some storage engines, such as MyISAM, store the exact count. For other storage engines, such as InnoDB, this value is an approximation, and may vary from the actual value by as much as 40% to 50%. In such cases, use SELECT COUNT(*) to obtain an accurate count.

data_length.desc: For InnoDB, DATA_LENGTH is the approximate amount of space allocated for the clustered index, in bytes. Specifically, it is the clustered index size, in pages, multiplied by the InnoDB page size

index_length.desc: For InnoDB, INDEX_LENGTH is the approximate amount of space allocated for non-clustered indexes, in bytes. Specifically, it is the sum of non-clustered index sizes, in pages, multiplied by the InnoDB page size

table_rows.desc: The number of rows. Some storage engines, such as MyISAM, store the exact count. For other storage engines, such as InnoDB, this value is an approximation, and may vary from the actual value by as much as 40% to 50%. In such cases, use SELECT COUNT(*) to obtain an accurate count.

engine.Desc: The storage engine for the table. See The InnoDB Storage Engine, and Alternative Storage Engines.

table_schema.Desc: The name of the schema (database) to which the table belongs.

table_type.Desc: BASE TABLE for a table, VIEW for a view, or SYSTEM VIEW for an INFORMATION_SCHEMA table.

version.Desc: The version number of the table's .frm file.

bytes_received.desc: The number of bytes received this user

bytes_sent.desc: The number of bytes sent this user

max_execution_time_exceeded.desc: The number of SELECT statements for which the execution timeout was exceeded.

max_execution_time_set.desc: The number of SELECT statements for which a nonzero execution timeout was set. This includes statements that include a nonzero MAX_EXECUTION_TIME optimizer hint, and statements that include no such hint but execute while the timeout indicated by the max_execution_time system variable is nonzero.

max_execution_time_set_failed.desc: The number of SELECT statements for which the attempt to set an execution timeout failed.

slow_queries.desc: The number of queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds. This counter increments regardless of whether the slow query log is enabled

sort_scan.desc: The number of sorts that were done by scanning the table.

table_open_cache_hits.desc: The number of hits for open tables cache lookups.

table_open_cache_misses.desc: The number of misses for open tables cache lookups.

table_open_cache_overflows.desc: The number of overflows for the open tables cache. This is the number of times, after a table is opened or closed, a cache instance has an unused entry and the size of the instance is larger than table_open_cache / table_open_cache_instances.

bytes_recv.desc: The number of bytes received by the interface.

bytes_recv/sec.desc: The number of bytes received by the interface per second.

bytes_sent.desc: The number of bytes sent by the interface .

bytes_sent/sec.desc: The number of bytes sent by the interface per second.

drop_in.desc: The number of received packets dropped by the interface.

drop_out.desc: The number of transmitted packets dropped by the interface.

err_in.desc: The number of receive errors detected by the interface.

err_out.desc: The number of transmit errors detected by the interface.

packets_recv.desc: The number of packets received by the interface.

packets_recv/sec.desc: The number of packets received by the interface per second.

packets_sent.desc: The number of packets sent by the interface.

packets_sent/sec.desc: The number of packets sent by the interface per second.

tcp_activeopens.desc: It means the TCP layer sends a SYN, and come into the SYN-SENT state.

tcp_attemptfails.desc: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state, plus the number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the LISTEN state from the SYN-RCVD state.

tcp_currestab.desc: The number of TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT.

tcp_estabresets.desc: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state.

tcp_incsumerrors.desc: The number of incoming TCP segments in checksum error

tcp_inerrs.desc: The number of incoming TCP segments in error

tcp_insegs.desc: The number of packets received by the TCP layer.

tcp_insegs/sec.desc: The number of packets received by the TCP layer per second.

tcp_maxconn.desc: The limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support.

tcp_outrsts.desc: The number of TCP segments sent containing the RST flag.

tcp_outsegs.desc: The number of packets sent by the TCP layer.

tcp_outsegs/sec.desc: The number of packets sent by the TCP layer per second.

tcp_passiveopens.desc: It means the TCP layer receives a SYN, replies a SYN+ACK, come into the SYN-RCVD state.

tcp_retranssegs.desc: The total number of segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmittedoctets.

tcp_rtoalgorithm.desc: The algorithm used to determine the timeout value used for retransmitting unacknowledged octets.

tcp_rtomax.desc: The maximum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds.

tcp_rtomin.desc: The minimum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds.

udp_incsumerrors.desc: The number of incoming UDP datagrams in checksum error

udp_indatagrams.desc: The number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users.

udp_indatagrams/sec.desc: The number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users per second.

udp_inerrors.desc: The number of packet receive errors

udp_noports.desc: The number of packets to unknown port received.

udp_outdatagrams.desc: The number of UDP datagrams sent from this entity.

udp_outdatagrams/sec.desc: The number of UDP datagrams sent from this entity per second.

udp_rcvbuferrors.desc: The number of receive buffer errors.

udp_sndbuferrors.desc: The number of send buffer errors.

src_port.Desc: 源端口, 临时端口(32768 ~ 60999)聚合后的值为 `*`

connection_active.desc: The current number of active client connections

connection_handled.desc: The total number of handled client connections

connection_reading.desc: The total number of reading client connections

connection_requests.desc: The total number of requests client connections

connection_waiting.desc: The total number of waiting client connections

connection_writing.desc: The total number of writing client connections

load_timestamp.desc: Loaded process time in milliseconds, when exist by open vts

host.Desc: host mame which installed nginx,use vts exist

max_size.desc: The limit on the maximum size of the cache specified in the configuration

receive.desc: The total number of bytes received from the cache.

sent.desc: The total number of bytes sent from the cache.

used_size.desc: The current size of the cache.

received.desc: The total amount of data received from clients.

request_count.desc: The total number of client requests received from clients.

response_1xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 1xx

response_2xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 2xx

response_3xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 3xx

response_4xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 4xx

response_5xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 5xx

sent.desc: The total amount of data sent to clients.

received.desc: The total number of bytes received from this server.

request_count.desc: The total number of client requests received from server.

response_1xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 1xx

response_2xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 2xx

response_3xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 3xx

response_4xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 4xx

response_5xx.desc: The number of responses with status codes 5xx

sent.desc: The total number of bytes sent to clients.

nsq_nodes.desc: NSQ 集群所有 node 的指标

backend_depth.desc: 超出 men-queue-size 的未被消费的消息总数

depth.desc: 在当前 node 中未被消费的消息总数

message_count.desc: 当前 node 处理的消息总数量

nsq_topics.desc: NSQ 集群所有 topic 的指标

backend_depth.desc: 超出 men-queue-size 的未被消费的消息总数

deferred_count.desc: 重新入队并且还没有准备好重新发送的消息数量

depth.desc: 在当前 channel 中未被消费的消息总数

in_flight_count.desc: 发送过程中或者客户端处理过程中的数量，客户端没有发送 FIN、REQ(重新入队列) 和超时的消息数量

message_count.desc: 当前 channel 处理的消息总数量

requeue_count.desc: 超时或者客户端发送 REQ 的消息数量

timeout_count.desc: 超时未处理的消息数量

pga_max_mem.desc: PGA maximum memory ever allocated by process

blks_hit.desc: The number of times disk blocks were found in the buffer cache, preventing the need to read from the database.

blks_read.desc: The number of disk blocks read in this database.

buffers_backend.desc: The number of buffers written directly by a backend.

buffers_backend_fsync.desc: The of times a backend had to execute its own fsync call instead of the background writer.

buffers_checkpoint.desc: The number of buffers written during checkpoints.

buffers_clean.desc: The number of buffers written by the background writer.

checkpoint_sync_time.desc: The total amount of checkpoint processing time spent synchronizing files to disk.

checkpoint_write_time.desc: The total amount of checkpoint processing time spent writing files to disk.

checkpoints_req.desc: The number of requested checkpoints that were performed.

checkpoints_timed.desc: The number of scheduled checkpoints that were performed.

database_size.desc: The disk space used by this database.

deadlocks.desc: The number of deadlocks detected in this database.

max_connections.desc: The maximum number of client connections allowed to this database.

maxwritten_clean.desc: The number of times the background writer stopped a cleaning scan due to writing too many buffers.

numbackends.desc: The number of active connections to this database.

percent_usage_connections.desc: The number of connections to this database as a fraction of the maximum number of allowed connections.

temp_bytes.desc: The amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database.

temp_files.desc: The number of temporary files created by queries in this database.

tup_deleted.desc: The number of rows deleted by queries in this database.

tup_fetched.desc: The number of rows fetched by queries in this database.

tup_inserted.desc: The number of rows inserted by queries in this database.

tup_returned.desc: The number of rows returned by queries in this database.

tup_updated.desc: The number of rows updated by queries in this database.

xact_commit.desc: The number of transactions that have been committed in this database.

xact_rollback.desc: The number of transactions that have been rolled back in this database.

message_ack_count.desc: Number of messages in exchanges delivered to clients and acknowledged

message_ack_rate.desc: Rate of messages in exchanges delivered to clients and acknowledged per second

message_confirm_count.desc: Count of messages in exchanges confirmed

message_confirm_rate.desc: Rate of messages in exchanges confirmed per second

message_deliver_get_count.desc: Sum of messages in exchanges delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers, in no-acknowledgement mode to consumers, in acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get, and in no-acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get

message_deliver_get_rate.desc: Rate per second of the sum of exchange messages delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers, in no-acknowledgement mode to consumers, in acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get, and in no-acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get

message_publish_count.desc: Count of messages in exchanges published

message_publish_in_count.desc: Count of messages published from channels into this exchange

message_publish_in_rate.desc: Rate of messages published from channels into this exchange per sec

message_publish_out_count.desc: Count of messages published from this exchange into queues

message_publish_out_rate.desc: Rate of messages published from this exchange into queues per second

message_publish_rate.desc: Rate of messages in exchanges published per second

message_redeliver_count.desc: Count of subset of messages in exchanges in deliver_get which had the redelivered flag set

message_redeliver_rate.desc: Rate of subset of messages in exchanges in deliver_get which had the redelivered flag set per second

message_return_unroutable_count.desc: Count of messages in exchanges returned to publisher as unroutable

message_return_unroutable_count_rate.desc: Rate of messages in exchanges returned to publisher as unroutable per second

auto_delete.Desc: If set, the exchange is deleted when all queues have finished using it

durable.Desc: If set when creating a new exchange, the exchange will be marked as durable. Durable exchanges remain active when a server restarts. Non-durable exchanges (transient exchanges) are purged if/when a server restarts.

internal.Desc: If set, the exchange may not be used directly by publishers, but only when bound to other exchanges. Internal exchanges are used to construct wiring that is not visible to applications

disk_free_alarm.desc: Does the node have disk alarm

io_read_avg_time.desc: avg wall time (milliseconds) for each disk read operation in the last statistics interval

io_seek_avg_time.desc: average wall time (milliseconds) for each seek operation in the last statistics interval

io_sync_avg_time.desc: average wall time (milliseconds) for each fsync() operation in the last statistics interval

io_write_avg_time.desc: avg wall time (milliseconds) for each disk write operation in the last statistics interval

mem_alarm.desc: Does the node have mem alarm

mem_limit.desc: Memory usage high watermark in bytes

run_queue.desc: Average number of Erlang processes waiting to run

running.desc: Is the node running or not

sockets_used.desc: Number of file descriptors used as sockets

message_ack_count.desc: Number of messages delivered to clients and acknowledged

message_ack_rate.desc: Rate of messages delivered to clients and acknowledged per second

message_confirm_rate.desc: Rate of messages confirmed per second

message_deliver_get_count.desc: Sum of messages delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers, in no-acknowledgement mode to consumers, in acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get, and in no-acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get

message_deliver_get_rate.desc: Rate per second of the sum of messages delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers, in no-acknowledgement mode to consumers, in acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get, and in no-acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get

message_publish_in_count.desc: Count of messages published from channels into this overview

message_publish_in_rate.desc: Rate of messages published from channels into this overview per sec

message_publish_out_count.desc: Count of messages published from this overview into queues

message_publish_out_rate.desc: Rate of messages published from this overview into queues per second

message_publish_rate.desc: Rate of messages published per second

message_redeliver_count.desc: Count of subset of messages in deliver_get which had the redelivered flag set

message_redeliver_rate.desc: Rate of subset of messages in deliver_get which had the redelivered flag set per second

message_return_unroutable_count.desc: Count of messages returned to publisher as unroutable

message_return_unroutable_count_rate.desc: Rate of messages returned to publisher as unroutable per second

queue_totals_messages_count.desc: Total number of messages (ready plus unacknowledged)

queue_totals_messages_rate.desc: Total rate of messages (ready plus unacknowledged)

queue_totals_messages_ready_count.desc: Number of messages ready for delivery

queue_totals_messages_ready_rate.desc: Rate of number of messages ready for delivery

queue_totals_messages_unacknowledged_rat.desc: Rate of number of unacknowledged messages

bindings_count.desc: Number of bindings for a specific queue

consumers.desc: The ratio of time that a queue's consumers can take new messages

head_message_timestamp.desc: Timestamp of the head message of the queue. Shown as millisecond

memory.desc: Bytes of memory consumed by the Erlang process associated with the queue, including stack, heap and internal structures

message.desc: Count of the total messages in the queue

message_ack_count.desc: Number of messages in queues delivered to clients and acknowledged

message_ack_rate.desc: Number per second of messages delivered to clients and acknowledged

message_deliver_count.desc: Count of messages delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers

message_deliver_get_count.desc: Sum of messages in queues delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers, in no-acknowledgement mode to consumers, in acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get, and in no-acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get.

message_deliver_get_rate.desc: Rate per second of the sum of messages in queues delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers, in no-acknowledgement mode to consumers, in acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get, and in no-acknowledgement mode in response to basic.get.

message_deliver_rate.desc: Rate of messages delivered in acknowledgement mode to consumers

message_publish_count.desc: Count of messages in queues published

message_publish_rate.desc: Rate per second of messages published

message_redeliver_count.desc: Count of subset of messages in queues in deliver_get which had the redelivered flag set

message_redeliver_rate.desc: Rate per second of subset of messages in deliver_get which had the redelivered flag set

messages_rate.desc: Count per second of the total messages in the queue

messages_ready.desc: Number of messages ready to be delivered to clients

messages_ready_rate.desc: Number per second of messages ready to be delivered to clients

messages_unacknowledged.desc: Number of messages delivered to clients but not yet acknowledged

messages_unacknowledged_rate.desc: Number per second of messages delivered to clients but not yet acknowledged

age.desc: Total duration of the connection in seconds

fd.desc: File descriptor corresponding to the socket

idle.desc: Idle time of the connection in seconds

name.Desc: The name set by the client with CLIENT SETNAME, default unknown

cluster_current_epoch.desc: The local Current Epoch variable. This is used in order to create unique increasing version numbers during fail overs.

cluster_known_nodes.desc: The total number of known nodes in the cluster, including nodes in HANDSHAKE state that may not currently be proper members of the cluster.

cluster_my_epoch.desc: The Config Epoch of the node we are talking with. This is the current configuration version assigned to this node.

cluster_size.desc: The number of master nodes serving at least one hash slot in the cluster.

cluster_slots_assigned.desc: Number of slots which are associated to some node (not unbound). This number should be 16384 for the node to work properly, which means that each hash slot should be mapped to a node.

cluster_slots_fail.desc: Number of hash slots mapping to a node in FAIL state. If this number is not zero the node is not able to serve queries unless cluster-require-full-coverage is set to no in the configuration.

cluster_slots_ok.desc: Number of hash slots mapping to a node not in FAIL or PFAIL state.

cluster_slots_pfail.desc: Number of hash slots mapping to a node in PFAIL state. Note that those hash slots still work correctly, as long as the PFAIL state is not promoted to FAIL by the failure detection algorithm. PFAIL only means that we are currently not able to talk with the node, but may be just a transient error.

cluster_state.desc: State is ok if the node is able to receive queries. fail if there is at least one hash slot which is unbound (no node associated), in error state (node serving it is flagged with FAIL flag), or if the majority of masters can't be reached by this node.

cluster_stats_messages_received.desc: Number of messages received via the cluster node-to-node binary bus.

cluster_stats_messages_sent.desc: Number of messages sent via the cluster node-to-node binary bus.

calls.desc: The number of calls that reached command execution

usec.desc: The total CPU time consumed by these commands

usec_per_call.desc: The average CPU consumed per command execution

active_defrag_hits.desc: Number of value reallocations performed by active the defragmentation process

active_defrag_key_hits.desc: Number of keys that were actively defragmented

active_defrag_key_misses.desc: Number of keys that were skipped by the active defragmentation process

active_defrag_misses.desc: Number of aborted value reallocations started by the active defragmentation process

active_defrag_running.desc: Flag indicating if active defragmentation is active

aof_last_rewrite_time_sec.desc: Duration of the last AOF rewrite operation in seconds

aof_rewrite_in_progress.desc: Flag indicating a AOF rewrite operation is on-going

blocked_clients.desc: Number of clients pending on a blocking call (BLPOP, BRPOP, BRPOPLPUSH, BLMOVE, BZPOPMIN, BZPOPMAX)

client_biggest_input_buf.desc: Biggest input buffer among current client connections

client_longest_output_list.desc: Longest output list among current client connections

connected_clients.desc: Number of client connections (excluding connections from replicas)

evicted_keys.desc: Number of evicted keys due to maxmemory limit

expired_keys.desc: Total number of key expiration events

info_latency_ms.desc: The latency of the redis INFO command.

keyspace_hits.desc: Number of successful lookup of keys in the main dictionary

keyspace_misses.desc: Number of failed lookup of keys in the main dictionary

latest_fork_usec.desc: Duration of the latest fork operation in microseconds

loading_eta_seconds.desc: ETA in seconds for the load to be complete

loading_loaded_perc.desc: Same value expressed as a percentage

master_last_io_seconds_ago.desc: Number of seconds since the last interaction with master

master_sync_in_progress.desc: Indicate the master is syncing to the replica

master_sync_left_bytes.desc: Number of bytes left before syncing is complete (may be negative when master_sync_total_bytes is 0)

maxmemory.desc: The value of the maxmemory configuration directive

pubsub_channels.desc: Global number of pub/sub channels with client subscriptions

pubsub_patterns.desc: Global number of pub/sub pattern with client subscriptions

rdb_bgsave_in_progress.desc: Flag indicating a RDB save is on-going

rdb_changes_since_last_save.desc: Refers to the number of operations that produced some kind of changes in the dataset since the last time either SAVE or BGSAVE was called.

rdb_last_bgsave_time_sec.desc: Duration of the last RDB save operation in seconds

rejected_connections.desc: Number of connections rejected because of maxclients limit

repl_backlog_histlen.desc: Size in bytes of the data in the replication backlog buffer

slave_repl_offset.desc: The replication offset of the replica instance

total_net_input_bytes.desc: The total number of bytes read from the network

total_net_output_bytes.desc: The total number of bytes written to the network

used_cpu_sys.desc: System CPU consumed by the Redis server, which is the sum of system CPU consumed by all threads of the server process (main thread and background threads)

used_cpu_sys_children.desc: System CPU consumed by the background processes

used_cpu_user.desc: User CPU consumed by the Redis server, which is the sum of user CPU consumed by all threads of the server process (main thread and background threads)

used_cpu_user_children.desc: User CPU consumed by the background processes

used_memory.desc: Total number of bytes allocated by Redis using its allocator (either standard libc, jemalloc, or an alternative allocator such as tcmalloc)

used_memory_lua.desc: Number of bytes used by the Lua engine

used_memory_overhead.desc: The sum in bytes of all overheads that the server allocated for managing its internal data structures

used_memory_peak.desc: Peak memory consumed by Redis (in bytes)

used_memory_rss.desc: Number of bytes that Redis allocated as seen by the operating system (a.k.a resident set size)

used_memory_startup.desc: Initial amount of memory consumed by Redis at startup in bytes

max_cost_time.desc: All-time maximum latency for this event.

occur_time.desc: Unix timestamp of the latest latency spike for the event.

temp*_crit_alarm.desc: Alarm count, '*' is the order number in the chip list.

temp*_input.desc: Current input temperature of this chip, '*' is the order number in the chip list.

tmep*_crit.desc: Critical temperature of this chip, '*' is the order number in the chip list.

tmep*_max.desc: Max temperature of this chip, '*' is the order number in the chip list.

airflow_temperature_cel_raw_value.desc: The raw value of air celsius temperature read from device record.

airflow_temperature_cel_threshold.desc: The threshold of air celsius temperature read from device record.

airflow_temperature_cel_value.desc: The value of air celsius temperature read from device record.

airflow_temperature_cel_worst.desc: The worst value of air celsius temperature read from device record.

avg_write/erase_count_raw_value.desc: The raw value of average write/ease count.

avg_write/erase_count_value.desc: The value of average write/ease count.

avg_write/erase_count_worst.desc: The worst value of average write/ease count.

command_timeout_raw_value.desc: The raw value of command timeout.

command_timeout_worst.desc: The worst value of command timeout.

current_pending_sector_raw_value.desc: The raw value of current pending sector.

current_pending_sector_threshold.desc: The threshold of current pending sector.

current_pending_sector_value.desc: The value of current pending sector.

current_pending_sector_worst.desc: The worst value of current pending sector.

end-to-end_error_raw_value.desc: The raw value of bad data that loaded into cache and then written to the driver have had a different parity.

end-to-end_error_threshold.desc: The threshold of bad data that loaded into cache and then written to the driver have had a different parity.

end-to-end_error_value.desc: The value of bad data that loaded into cache and then written to the driver have had a different parity.

sqlserver_schedulers.desc: one row per scheduler in SQL Server where each scheduler is mapped to an individual processor,[detail](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/system-dynamic-management-views/sys-dm-os-schedulers-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15)

active_workers_count.desc: Number of workers that are active. An active worker is never preemptive, must have an associated task, and is either running, runnable, or suspended. Is not nullable.

context_switches_count.desc: Number of context switches that have occurred on this scheduler

current_tasks_count.desc: Number of current tasks that are associated with this scheduler.

current_workers_count.desc: Number of workers that are associated with this scheduler. This count includes workers that are not assigned any task. Is not nullable.

is_idle.desc: Scheduler is idle. No workers are currently running

is_online.desc: If SQL Server is configured to use only some of the available processors on the server, this configuration can mean that some schedulers are mapped to processors that are not in the affinity mask. If that is the case, this column returns 0. This value means that the scheduler is not being used to process queries or batches.

load_factor.desc: Internal value that indicates the perceived load on this scheduler

pending_disk_io_count.desc: Number of pending I/Os that are waiting to be completed.

preemptive_switches_count.desc: Number of times that workers on this scheduler have switched to the preemptive mode

runnable_tasks_count.desc: Number of workers, with tasks assigned to them, that are waiting to be scheduled on the runnable queue.

total_cpu_usage_ms.desc: Applies to: SQL Server 2016 (13.x) and laterTotal CPU consumed by this scheduler as reported by non-preemptive workers.

total_scheduler_delay_ms.desc: Applies to: SQL Server 2016 (13.x) and laterThe time between one worker switching out and another one switching in

work_queue_count.desc: Number of tasks in the pending queue. These tasks are waiting for a worker to pick them up

yield_count.desc: Internal value that is used to indicate progress on this scheduler. This value is used by the Scheduler Monitor to determine whether a worker on the scheduler is not yielding to other workers on time.

cpu_id.Desc: CPU ID assigned to the scheduler.

scheduler_id.Desc: ID of the scheduler. All schedulers that are used to run regular queries have ID numbers less than 1048576. Those schedulers that have IDs greater than or equal to 1048576 are used internally by SQL Server, such as the dedicated administrator connection scheduler. Is not nullable.

sqlserver_waitstats.desc: information about all the waits encountered by threads that executed,[detail](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/system-dynamic-management-views/sys-dm-os-wait-stats-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15)

max_wait_time_ms.desc: Maximum wait time on this wait type.

signal_wait_time_ms.desc: Difference between the time that the waiting thread was signaled and when it started running

wait_time_ms.desc: Total wait time for this wait type in milliseconds. This time is inclusive of signal_wait_time_ms

waiting_tasks_count.desc: Number of waits on this wait type. This counter is incremented at the start of each wait.

wait_type.Desc: Name of the wait type. For more information, see Types of Waits, later in this topic
